@OfficialBBrooks @IncisiveThought Much appreciated. My goal is to help people in their NFT journey, but last night was definitely a set back for those on the edge and paying attention.

I just hope we learn from this and tighten security, but it‚Äôs a long road ahead.

@IncisiveThought @OfficialBBrooks My hunch is others will feel the same.

What I‚Äôm building with @futurenftmints is intended to bring more transparency and research to the space, but when the major players can‚Äôt act properly, it hurts us all.

@IncisiveThought @OfficialBBrooks The point is that this issue which impacted 32 people became the spark for mass panic last night.

It speaks to some key challenges in the NFT space, and as @OfficialBBrooks has clearly stated, he‚Äôs even more hesistant to get involved in the space.

@IncisiveThought @OfficialBBrooks It appears that the victims signed something that gave the hacker permission to drain their NFTs and wallets.

But as the tweet thread I referenced above explains, there is no clear / common attack vector.

@IncisiveThought @OfficialBBrooks But the issue rn is that no one really understands what happens. What @OfficialBBrooks linked was one of the victims throwing blame at OpenSea with no specific evidence, which is part of what‚Äôs led to the chaos and confusion.

@IncisiveThought @OfficialBBrooks Last night, a few accounts suddenly saw their ETH drained and valuable NFTs transferred out. They began posting on Twitter, and since most were huge wallets (100+ ETH), everyone took notice and became super cautious.

Lots of confusion and it was scary‚Ä¶

Had to deal with the first malicious spammer today. 

I take that as a good sign lol

@EmilioSantias @chrismaddern I‚Äôve seen the address somewhere but didn‚Äôt dig into the specific contract.

This is a good read.

It also highlights the structural vulnerabilities of decentralization since coordination is a key part of centralization.

We have a LONG road ahead. https://t.co/p4mEXRJQP6

@OfficialBBrooks Like why was this info being sent from the CEOs personal account?

Why wasn‚Äôt more info given about the new contract? Why wasn‚Äôt it released publicly for a week or two for every security expert to review? Why not add a bug bounty to incentivize scrutiny?

@OfficialBBrooks Part of the problem was the timing of everything since OS just did a major migration for which their communication strategy was extremely bad.

This is one of their weaknesses - they do a bad job explaining things to people. They need to hire an entire comms‚Ä¶

@OfficialBBrooks The silly part is that everything was blown out of proportion. This impacted 32 people.

A lot of misinformation was spread, likely to hurt OpenSea, but has ended up creating FUD about NFTs in general.

There is a lot that needs to be better in crypto. We‚Äôd love for you to help make it better.

Remember, as dear Teddy once said, it is not the critic who counts.

Come build with us, and fix all these problems you see.

You could be greatly rewarded by a community who values you.
And we also realize that crypto is a new economic tool that can help communities prosper in ways that only siloed corporations and a few individuals could in the past.
Many people in crypto (myself included) acknowledge the faults of crypto. We also know that many people are working to fix them.
If you spent just a few moments thinking about the things you claim are bad about crypto, you‚Äôd realize you aren‚Äôt upset about crypto, you‚Äôre upset about capitalism.

You say that you don‚Äôt like crypto because it consumes too much energy?

What are your thoughts on server farms or large banks or gas-powered cars, all huge power consumers with people working to reduce their dependence on so much energy?

You say that you don‚Äôt like crypto because it enables criminal activity?

What are your thoughts on the US dollar, which is anonymous, has no paper trail and is widely known as the currency of choice for illegal activity?

You say that crypto is bad because it disproportionately benefits those who get in early?

What are your thoughts on angel investing, venture capital, and the stock market, where early investors also disproportionately benefit?

This is literally what I've just done.

I recruited 5 people who are helping part-time to build @futurenftmints (Research, Project Management, Marketing, and Design). More on the way.
